description.narrative: The proposed Project is expected to have the following development impacts: - Increase the Access to finance: The project will increase the access to finance to the underserved mid-size corporate sector in Brazil. The project is also expected to expand IFC current efforts in this market segment by making medium term funding available to mid-size corporates. - Job creation: The fund will provide loans to the mid-size corporate sector, key employer in the Brazilian economy. Thus, supporting the fund in turn supports the primary drivers of job creation and growth in Brazil - Local Capital Markets Development: The project will help deepen and strengthen local Brazilian capital markets to the benefit of local mid-size firms. The Fund Manager aims to foster industry development, improve best practices, and overall raise the profile of this investment technique in Brazil.

The proposed project involves supporting Divitia Investimentos Ltda. (the Fund Manager) in raising and structuring Divitia FIM Crédito Privado Fund (the Fund or Project), a credit opportunity fund (COF). This capital market vehicle will mobilize local institutional investors to provide financing for domestic mid-size corporates that are underserved by the local banking sector. As part of IFCs Capital Market Development Strategy, the project has the potential to enhance capital market development in Brazil by channeling more capital flows than in the past from local institutional investors into under developed credit markets, enhancing capital market liquidity, extending available credit tenors, and supporting further primary issuance of new credit assets as well as its secondary market in the country. The Fund can influence the local industry and set up high standards as well as performances that may consolidate the COFs as a new investible asset class for local institutional investors.
